user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash_hex:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash_hex (enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgo3 algo3,
                                   const char *username,
                                   const char *realm,
                                   char *userhash_hex,
                                   size_t hex_buf_size)
{
  uint8_t userhash_bin[MAX_DIGEST];
  size_t digest_size;

  digest_size = digest_get_hash_size (algo3);
  if (digest_size * 2 + 1 > hex_buf_size)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (MHD_NO == MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (algo3, username, realm,
                                               userhash_bin, MAX_DIGEST))
    return MHD_NO;

  MHD_bin_to_hex_z (userhash_bin, digest_size, userhash_hex);
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No suspicious fragments found. The rule targets invariant controlling expressions (conditions of if/while/for/do-while that are constant). This function contains two conditional statements but neither is invariant:

- if (digest_size * 2 + 1 > hex_buf_size)
  - digest_size is obtained at run-time from digest_get_hash_size(algo3) and hex_buf_size is a function parameter, so the expression is not a compile-time constant or invariant.

- if (MHD_NO == MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (algo3, username, realm, userhash_bin, MAX_DIGEST))
  - the controlling expression depends on the return value of MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash, which is a run-time function call and thus not invariant. Although MHD_NO is an enumeration/constant, the overall expression is not constant.

There are no loop constructs (while/for/do-while) with controlling expressions in this function, so the specified MISRA Rule 14.3 (controlling expressions shall not be invariant) has no applicable violations in the presented code fragment.
